New Records: England's best bowling performance in T20 World Cup, bowling Oman out for just 47 runs.
England set a World Cup record by winning with 101 balls remaining, the largest win in T20 World Cup history in terms of balls remaining.
Key Match Events: Rashid took 4 wickets for 11 runs with mesmerizing leg-spin.
Archer took 3 wickets for 12 runs with the new ball.
Wood also picked up 3 wickets for 12 runs, bowling with real pace.
England chased down the target in just 19 balls, finishing at 50 for 2 from 3.1 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler praised the bowlers for setting the tone by picking up early wickets and emphasized the importance of taking advantage of the net run-rate.
Oman captain Aqib Ilyas acknowledged the team's poor batting performance and highlighted the learning experience from playing against top players.
Man of the match Adil Rashid expressed happiness with the team's bowling performance and emphasized taking it one game at a time.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, North Sound, Antigua.
England's net run-rate improved to 3.081, better than Scotland's 2.16.
